ore@cave.name: ore
ore@cave.examine: Just your everyday piece of magical ore.
ore@cave.desc[0]: A large clump of mithril ore lays at your feet.

ruby@cave.name: ruby
ruby@cave.examine: The ruby glows with a pleasant red light.  It looks quite valuable.
ruby@cave.desc[0]: A huge ruby sparkles at your feet.

door_armory@cave.name: Door_Armory
door_armory@cave.examine: It's an armored door.  What else do you expect in an armory?

cutlery@cave.name: cutlery
cutlery@cave.examine: You see a fork, a small fruit knife, and two medium spoons, all gold.
cutlery@cave.desc[0]: Some gold cutlery has been left here.

bat@cave.name: bat
bat@cave.examine:
This bat is dead, deceased, it has gone away, it is no longer a bat, it has
flown away to the great perch in the sky.  Leave the poor thing alone...
bat@cave.desc[0]: A dead bat decays slowly in a corner.

dwarfcoin@cave.name: DwarfCoin
dwarfcoin@cave.examine:
The coin bears a profile view of Jim Morrison on one side.  On the other side
is engraved a fiery ring with people walking through it.
dwarfcoin@cave.desc[0]: A silver coin has been dropped here.

gates2@cave.desc[1]: Large gates block any further passage.
gates2@cave.name: gates2
gates2@cave.desc[2]: Solid stone gates stand locked before you.
gates2@cave.desc[0]: Large stone gates are pushed open.

gates@cave.name: gates
gates@cave.examine: A sign on the gates reads "Pete's Pearly Hire Co."

wall@cave.name: wall
wall@cave.desc[0]: The wall here is shifted, allowing an exit to the south.

diamond@cave.name: diamond
diamond@cave.examine:
This diamond is really huge, almost the size of your fist.  It has a faint
blue tint, making it even more valuable.
diamond@cave.desc[0]: There is a huge diamond on the floor in front of you.

forge@cave.desc[1]: A large forge sits in the middle of the room awaiting use.
forge@cave.name: forge
forge@cave.examine: A huge forge made of stone.
forge@cave.desc[0]: The forge has been shifted to the side, revealing a leading down.

door_hall@cave.name: Door_Hall
door_hall@cave.examine: It's an armored door.  What else do you expect in an armory?

armor@cave.name: armor
armor@cave.desc[0]: A tarnished suit of armor has been left here.

drakeshield@cave.name: drakeshield
drakeshield@cave.examine: It looks like it could be used as a shield, why don't you try.
drakeshield@cave.desc[0]: A large scale of a Firedrake lies on the ground.

claymore@cave.name: claymore
claymore@cave.examine:
This claymore seems very well crafted.  Its balance is excellent, and its
leather hilt soft and comfortable.  An inscription reads "Connor McCleod".
claymore@cave.desc[0]: A wicked looking claymore, decorated with silver wire lies at your feet.

sporran@cave.name: sporran
sporran@cave.examine: Although empty, this purse should come in handy.
sporran@cave.desc[0]: A Scottish sporran has been dumped here.

ceiling@cave.name: ceiling
ceiling@cave.desc[0]: A hole is here in the ceiling, just large enough for you to fit through.

warhammer@cave.name: warhammer
warhammer@cave.examine: It seems a bit big for just banging in nails, I must say!
warhammer@cave.desc[0]: A large, heavy looking warhammer has been left here.

mithril@cave.desc[1]:
The newly Great Death axe of Mithril lies on the forge, glowing with an inner
light.
mithril@cave.name: mithril
mithril@cave.examine:
You see the Mighty Death Axe of Mithril which has an inner power that seems
to glow and guide your death blows on you foes.
mithril@cave.desc[0]: The Great Death axe of Mithril lies at your feet glowing with an inner light.

bagpipes@cave.name: bagpipes
bagpipes@cave.examine: It looks like a dead animal, and sounds even worse.
bagpipes@cave.desc[0]: A set of bagpipes lie here, waiting to be played.

axe@cave.name: axe
axe@cave.examine:
The words 'If found, please return to thrower' are written on the handle.
This, taken with the fact that the axe is the dwarves' favorite weapon, would
indicate something of it's origins...
axe@cave.desc[0]:
A small axe, marked with the words 'If found, please return to thrower' lies
before you.

gates1@cave.desc[1]: Large gates block any further passage.
gates1@cave.name: gates1
gates1@cave.desc[2]: Solid stone gates stand locked before you.
gates1@cave.desc[0]: Large stone gates are pushed open.

sapphire@cave.name: sapphire
sapphire@cave.examine:
The sapphire is about the size of a plover's egg, and is almost clear when
you look into it.
sapphire@cave.desc[0]: A massive sapphire glitters stunningly before you.

biscuit@cave.name: biscuit
biscuit@cave.examine: The biscuit is truly very hard.  It was perhaps made out of dried sawdust.
biscuit@cave.desc[0]: A hard biscuit has been dropped here.

volume@cave.name: volume
volume@cave.examine:
Enhancers work only if you hold them directly.  They will not
work if they are in a backpack you are wearing.

For spells that change strength, mostly attack spells, but also
Aid, an enhancer will double the effect.  For spells which have
a duration,  such as Lit and Protect, an enhancer will triple
the duration of the spell.

There may be enhancers for spells besides those described in
the Volumes of the Book of Knowledge.  These can be determined
by use of Reveal.
volume@cave.desc[0]: &+YVolume VII&N of the &+WBook of Knowledge&N lies here.

whistle@cave.name: whistle
whistle@cave.examine:
Etched on the whistle there is a small inscription that says
"Thy rid my mines and thy shall have the almighty axe of Mithril.  This
 whistle will show the way!  Blow it so obstacles will not block the way.
                              ----------- The Forgemaster of Thorbadin"

                           |The Depths of Thorbadin|
                              ||
                              -------------------> Great Death
                              -------------------> Lies ahead
                              ||
                              ||
                          |go down by|
                          |the  forge|
                              ||
                              ||
                              ||
                              ||
                          |Armoury| <------Prove yourself
whistle@cave.desc[0]: A small golden whistle lies here attached to a chain.

dwarfcrystal@cave.name: DwarfCrystal
dwarfcrystal@cave.examine:
You peer into the crystal...
You see an image of a panther about to strike!
Curiously, the panther is pink.
dwarfcrystal@cave.desc[0]: A beautiful, well cut crystal glints in front of you.

hole@cave.name: hole
hole@cave.examine: A hole, about the diameter of a weapon hilt, is in the wall.
hole@cave.desc[0]: The wall here is shifted, allowing an entrance to the north.

dwarfale@cave.name: DwarfAle
dwarfale@cave.examine:
This fine ale is one of the better spirits associated with the Moog, who has
been known to indulge in vast quantities of the drink!
dwarfale@cave.desc[0]: A large bottle of strong ale has been left here.

platesilver@cave.name: PlateSilver
platesilver@cave.examine:
An engraving on the plate reads:
"This plate was made to commemorate the exploits of one Cannonfod The Killer.
                          The Phantom"
platesilver@cave.desc[0]: A silver plate has been left here.

341@cave.title: Fire Blasted Tunnel
341@cave.description:
The walls glow a faint red as heat cause you to sweat profusely.  The walls
have been fire blasted to as smooth as glass.  To the east seems to be the
source of the heat.  Back to the west you can see the dark passage continues.

long@cave.title: Long Passage
long@cave.description:
You are following a long narrow passage which runs west to a door, and turns
north into a hall.

haggis@cave.title: The Lair Of The Haggis
haggis@cave.description:
This small cave smells of the distinctive odour of haggis, its narrow
entrance, and tiny size ensures that two people could not easily enter at the
same time.  To the south another small entrance leads into a larger cave.

342@cave.title: Lair of the FireDrake
342@cave.description:
The room is very large, you can not see the ceiling for it is lost in the
darkness.  A large crack is releasing large amounts of heat causing you to
sweat profusely.

landing@cave.title: Upper Landing
landing@cave.description:
You are standing on the upper landing looking over the lower levels of the
great hall.  A set of stairs lead down into the hall itself, while at various
points around the landing doorways lead off.

n_stairs3@cave.title: Narrow Stairs
n_stairs3@cave.description:
The stairs end abruptly in a small room hewn from the living rock. The walls
are rough, giving this room that "about to be worked on" feel.  At the moment,
however, your only exit is back up the stairs.
There is a blinking construction sign here.

passage@cave.title: Passage
passage@cave.description:
You are following a narrow passage that leads east-west, linking the west
tower and the Great Hall.

tunnel@cave.title: Dwarven Tunnel
tunnel@cave.description:
You are standing at a junction between passages.  A passage leads north and
south, while another branches off to the east.

w_tower@cave.title: West Tower
w_tower@cave.description:
You are in a small room at the base of the west tower.  A narrow passage
leads east, and a set of spiral stairs climb up towards the top of the tower.

top_east@cave.title: Top Of East Tower
top_east@cave.description:
You are standing at the top of the east tower.  A narrow staircase winds
down, and to the west is a door.

wide@cave.title: Wide Passage
wide@cave.description:
You are standing in a wide but low dwarven passage way which leads south and
west.  There is a door to the north.

throne@cave.title: The Throne Room
throne@cave.description:
You stand in the center of the Dwarven Throne room, a vast arched hall whose
ceiling appears to be a huge picture of a dwarf's head made purely from rare
and precious metals.  A single door leads south.

guardroom@cave.title: Dwarven Guardroom
guardroom@cave.description:
You are in what appears to be a dwarven guardroom.   The roof is low and you
have to crouch down inside it.  A door leads south.

335@cave.title: The Gates of Thorbadin
335@cave.description:
You stand in a large room where stone has been smoothed to perfection.
This is obviously the work of dwarven artisens.

small@cave.title: The Small Room
small@cave.description:
You are in a small room at the top of a narrow flight of stairs.  The room
looks bare and empty and is one of those rooms which have no real reason to
exist apart from linking two other rooms together.

kitchen@cave.title: Dwarven Kitchen
kitchen@cave.description:
You are in a sooty, low roofed kitchen.  An exit leads north into a small
pantry, and another leads east into a large hall.

336@cave.title: The Forge
336@cave.description:
This is a large circular room where dwarven craftsman have crafted the many
mighty weapons of dwarven kings of past.  You sense great magics have been cast
here upon those weapons.

smithy@cave.title: Dwarven Smithy
smithy@cave.description:
You are standing in the smithy, a large room given over to one of the
dwarves great skills.  A narrow doorway leads west.

side@cave.title: Side Cellar
side@cave.description:
You are standing in a small damp side cellar.  The cellar is cold and musty
and probably also serves as the dwarven cold store.

333@cave.title: Dark Passage
333@cave.description:
You stand in a long and extremely dark passage that leads northward into
a small room.

bedroom@cave.title: Dwarven Bedroom
bedroom@cave.description: You are in a dwarven bedroom.  A single doorway leads north.

pantry@cave.title: Pantry
pantry@cave.description: You are in the dwarves' pantry.  The only exit is south into the kitchens.

side_hall@cave.title: Side Hall
side_hall@cave.description:
You are standing in a small pillared side hall.  Less splendid than the
other halls, the room seems more sober and thoughtful.  A doorway leads west.

334@cave.title: The Rubble
334@cave.description:
Rubble is strewn all about the room.  Bones are scattered everywhere and
some rusted weapons are stuck in the wall.  A battle of long time past seems
to have taken place in the very place you are standing in.  You sense great
powers were used here in this battle.  The passage continues on northward.

337@cave.title: Entrance to the Thorbadin Mines
337@cave.description: Tunnels are delved into the darkness to the east and to the north.

hall@cave.title: Dwarven Hall
hall@cave.description:
You are in a pillared dwarven hall, with a high arched roof.  The carefully
sculpted ceiling bears a picture of Snow White at work, rest and play. The last
is by far the most interesting...
   Passages lead east and south, and a door lies north.

cellars@cave.title: Dwarven Cellars
cellars@cave.description:
You are in the huge cellar of the dwarven fortress.   Massive stone pillars
and arches bear the weight of the mighty stoneworks above.  A narrow staircase
winds down into darkness and up into the main castle hall.

claymore@cave.title: The Piper's Storeroom
claymore@cave.description:
You are in a small clean cave, which appears to serve as a storeroom for the
owner of the cave.  A single narrow exit leads north.

armory@cave.title: Armoury
armory@cave.description:
You are in a small dwarven armoury.  Strange, cobwebs adorn the walls...
except for the northern wall.  A door leads to the south.

top_west@cave.title: Top Of West Tower
top_west@cave.description:
You are in a small room at the top of the west tower.  It looks out across a
vast expanse of land.  As your eyes wander across the skyline you can pick out
the Desert of Fools, the valley and the black tower far in the distance.
Clearly this is the dwarven watch post in times of war.
   Stone stairs lead down.

340@cave.title: Dark Passage
340@cave.description:
The passage gradually begins to widen as you head to the east.  The passage
continues on to the west.

cavevol@cave.title: Eternal Treasure Room
cavevol@cave.description:
Here is a simple room, but polished as well as can be expected of a
lazy dragon.  He seems to recognise the eternal value of knowledge.

339@cave.title: Drop Off
339@cave.description:
The tunnel drops off too quickly and you lose your footing and fall to your
death on the rocks belo.  Geesh!! Come on, I told you the tunnel was very
steep to the north, you should have listened and went back!!!

treasury@cave.title: The Treasury
treasury@cave.description:
You are standing in the dwarven treasury.  A large and very well protected
room that few are privileged to see.  A single door leads east.
   There is a charred shape on the wall, somewhat resembling an ex neccy Moog
and scratched on the wall you see the words "Die Frog...the ex knight to be!".
A second notice reads "Who's he?" and another asks "What's a Moog?"

stairs@cave.title: Stairs
stairs@cave.description:
You are standing at the bottom of some dwarven stairs that lead north
along a passage, and up into what appears to be the cellars of a huge dwarven
fortress.

dining@cave.title: The Dwarven Dining Hall
dining@cave.description:
This huge hall is another tribute to the skilled stonework of the dwarves,
a circular hall with a spectacular painted domed roof that seems lost in the
shadows high above you.  From the walls, spectacularly carved gargoyles leer
down, attempting to put you off your food.
   Passages lead north, east and west.

338@cave.title: Slanted Tunnel
338@cave.description:
A dwarven tunnel continues steeply down to the north.  To the south a
gradual slope allows an easy climb out of the mine.

n_passage@cave.title: Narrow Passage
n_passage@cave.description:
You are standing in a narrow east west passage that links the east tower
with the Great Hall.

n_stairs2@cave.title: Narrow Stairs
n_stairs2@cave.description:
You are on a small landing on the narrow staircase.  The roof here is a mere
four feet high so you are forced to stoop.  There is a low door in the east
wall.  The stairs continue up and down from here.

great@cave.title: Great Hall
great@cave.description:
You stand in the dwarven Great Hall, a huge carved room of spectacular
design, with a massive fan-vaulted ceiling.  The spectacular arches and pillars
are all decorated with dwarvish battle scenes and, high up, dwarven momentos of
great age are hung, golden banners, shining axes, helms, and many other items
of war and craft.
   High arched exits lead north, east and south, a set of narrow stairs leads
down into the cellars, and a wide sweeping staircase leads up to a high balcony
overlooking the hall.

e_tower@cave.title: East Tower
e_tower@cave.description:
You are standing in the lower room of the east tower.  The room is bare and
the thick stone walls seem to hem you in.  A narrow staircase winds up to the
top of the tower, and a passage leads west.

gatehall@cave.title: Dwarven Gatehall
gatehall@cave.description:
You are standing in the dwarven gatehall.  A wide passage leads south into
the great hall.  To the north the huge dwarven gates stand solid, their massive
iron bulk ready to bar all entry in the event of a war.

store2@cave.title: Dwarven Store Room
store2@cave.description:
You are in a small dwarven store room.  To the south is another door, and
a passage leads west.

store@cave.title: Dwarven Store
store@cave.description:
You are in a dark shadowy store room.  A single door leads north.  There is
a small chute, too steep and slippery to climb, in the south wall.  Its purpose
is a complete mystery.

n_stairs@cave.title: Narrow Stairs
n_stairs@cave.description:
You are descending a set of narrow stairs which twist and turn sharply as
they plunge steeply down into darkness.  Above you the stairs flatten out into
a small room.

piper@cave.title: The Piper's Lair
piper@cave.description:
You are standing in a small dry cave, with a low roof some six feet high.
The cavemouth is to the north but is twisted enough that you cannot see out,
and it also provides good shelter against the wind.  To the south a narrow and
low arched opening leads into another cave.
   The cave is clean and evidently well used by its occupant although who he
is, its hard to tell.

forgemaster@cave.name: forgemaster
forgemaster@cave.description:
The Forgemaster, Master Craftsman of Thorbadin, works here on some powerful
magical weapon.

firedrake@cave.name: firedrake
firedrake@cave.description: The Firedrake of Thorbadin rests lazily on a pile of treasure.

keeper@cave.name: keeper
keeper@cave.description: The Keeper, Guardian of the Gates, challenges you to a duel to the DEATH!

haggis@cave.name: haggis
haggis@cave.description: A large, vicious looking haggis runs around squeaking.

smythe@cave.name: smythe
smythe@cave.description: Smythe The Upper Class Dwarven Smith stands here, worn by years at the forge.

diamar@cave.name: diamar
diamar@cave.description: Diamar says 'Have you seen my axe?  I wrote on it to return it to me.'

bomber@cave.name: bomber
bomber@cave.description: Bomber The Heavy-Fan Dwarf glares evilly at you.

owin@cave.name: owin
owin@cave.description: Owin The Broke Dwarf watches you suspiciously.

dragon@cave.name: dragon
dragon@cave.description: A huge fire-breathing dragon stares menacingly in your direction.

glowin@cave.name: glowin
glowin@cave.description: Glowin The Radioactive Dwarf looks menacingly at you.

dio@cave.name: dio
dio@cave.description: Dio The Singing Dwarf wanders around, singing arias.
